title.value: Screening methods for congenital anomalies in low and lower-middle income countries: A systematic review
title.justification: The title of the paper appears clearly at the beginning of the document, indicating the main focus of the study.
title.quote: Screening methods for congenital anomalies in low and lower-middle income countries: A systematic review

extractions.description: This study aims to identify feasible screening methods for surgically correctable congenital anomalies in low and lower-middle income countries, using a systematic review approach.

type.justification: The paper uses a systematic review method to identify screening methods, which involves collecting data from various sources and analyzing them.
type.quote: Methods: A systematic search looking at screening for congenital anomalies in LMIC was conducted in seven databases from 2000 until May 25, 2020, with no language restriction.

name.justification: The research focuses on congenital anomalies which are a significant concern in pediatric surgery.
name.quote: Introduction: Surgically correctable congenital anomalies are responsible for a significant burden of morbidity and mortality in children from low-and lower-middle-income countries (LMICs).

name.justification: The primary aim is to identify screening methods for congenital anomalies, making it a key subfield.
name.quote: This study aims to identify feasible screening methods for surgically correctable congenital anomalies in LMICs.

name.justification: Rayyan software was explicitly mentioned as a tool used to screen articles.
name.quote: Articles were screened by two independent contributors using Rayyan software, with a third contributor resolving conflicts.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Rayyan is a software tool used for the study, not tied to a specific referenced paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Articles were screened by two independent contributors using Rayyan software, with a third contributor resolving conflicts.
